creator: chip@force-elite.com
text: did you run ./buildconf yourself, or was this the release tarball?

(In reply to comment #2)
> did you run ./buildconf yourself, or was this the release tarball?

meaning? I taken it and lauched ./conigure script

I upgraded libtool and autoconf from GNU Site

With the "old" RH 7.3 libtool and autoconf all go fine.
creator: alcol@hotmail.com

text:
We asked if you had run ./buildconf upon obtaining the package.  If you don't
  plenty of stale information will persist.  It's also quite likely that there
  is some mismatched state information resulting from your autoconf 'upgrade'.

  Presuming this is a user-local issue, and look forward to your reopening this
  bug if you can provide specific information of how you handled the package
  (./buildconf or no, etc) and that it can be reproduced in apr-1.2.x or later.
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text:
the machine due to a disk error in not on anymore. It has been reinstalled but 
over that I have suspended the job on LDAP Auth support on Apache against an 
LDAP Server.

I don't have anymoer the enviroment or best I have a new one :) so the results 
could change only for that.
creator: alcol@hotmail.com

text:
I've come across this same issue on a brand new install from source.
the apr/buildconf script balks at "alias -g" which is a part of the configure
script. (GNU bash, version 2.05b.0): 

~/optcode/httpd/httpd-2.2.4/srclib/apr$ ./buildconf 
buildconf: checking installation...
buildconf: python version 2.3.5 (ok)
buildconf: autoconf version 2.61 (ok)
buildconf: libtool version 2.1a (ok)
Copying libtool helper files ...
./buildconf: line 5: alias: -g: invalid option
alias: usage: alias [-p] [name[=value] ... ]
./buildconf: eval: line 228: syntax error near unexpected token `&&'
./buildconf: eval: line 228: `        && { func_serial_max_result="$2"; break; }'
buildconf: Using libtool.m4 at /opt/share/aclocal/libtool.m4.
Creating include/arch/unix/apr_private.h.in ...
configure.in:181: warning: LTOPTIONS_VERSION is m4_require'd but not m4_defun'd
build/libtool.m4:83: LT_INIT is expanded from...
build/libtool.m4:86: AC_PROG_LIBTOOL is expanded from...
configure.in:181: the top level
configure.in:181: warning: LTSUGAR_VERSION is m4_require'd but not m4_defun'd
configure.in:181: warning: LTVERSION_VERSION is m4_require'd but not m4_defun'd
configure.in:181: warning: _LT_SET_OPTIONS is m4_require'd but not m4_defun'd
Creating configure ...
configure.in:181: warning: LTOPTIONS_VERSION is m4_require'd but not m4_defun'd
build/libtool.m4:83: LT_INIT is expanded from...
build/libtool.m4:86: AC_PROG_LIBTOOL is expanded from...
configure.in:181: the top level
configure.in:181: warning: LTSUGAR_VERSION is m4_require'd but not m4_defun'd
configure.in:181: warning: LTVERSION_VERSION is m4_require'd but not m4_defun'd
configure.in:181: warning: _LT_SET_OPTIONS is m4_require'd but not m4_defun'd
configure.in:200: error: possibly undefined macro: LT_VERSION
      If this token and others are legitimate, please use m4_pattern_allow.
      See the Autoconf documentation.
configure:9311: error: possibly undefined macro: _LT_SET_OPTIONS
configure:9400: error: possibly undefined macro: m4_ifval
Generating 'make' outputs ...
rebuilding rpm spec file

-------
Then the subsequent configure is fine up to:

performing libtool configuration...
./configure: line 9395: syntax error near unexpected token `lt_decl_varnames,'
./configure: line 9395: `lt_if_append_uniq(lt_decl_varnames, SED, [, ],'

libtool --version
ltmain.sh (GNU libtool 1.2443 2007/04/03 19:09:39) 2.1a
creator: ben@redsnapper.net
ben@redsnapper.net
text: WORKAROUND: Installing expat 2.0 appears to solve this problem.

Looks like a misconfiguration of the build machine.  Closing incident,
glad a new expat solved your bug.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
green_day_cristian@yahoo.com
text:
For me installing expat 2 did not fix the problem ?
could I get some help please ?
